image.altText: Woman speaks in parliament

props.synopsis: The NT government is set to urgently pass new bail laws today after the fatal stabbing of a Darwin supermarket owner, flagging an overhaul of youth justice laws is underway.

title.children: NT to pass urgent bail laws as government flags youth justice overhaul

image.altText: A man standing inside a room and holding out a machete to the camera.

props.synopsis: The 18-year-old charged with murder over the death of Darwin supermarket owner Linford Feick has faced court for the first time since the fatal stabbing.

title.children: Phillip Randel Maurice Parry faces court charged with murder of Darwin grocer

image.altText: Shuqin Li

props.synopsis: Members of Darwin's Chinese community are calling for federal Labor and the Coalition to reconsider their election promises to take back the lease of the Darwin Port.

title.children: Chinese community urges rethink on major parties' Darwin Port plans

image.altText: The facade of a new police station in Darwin's northern suburbs

props.synopsis: The unstaffed Nightcliff Police Station stands opposite to where 71-year-old supermarket owner Linford Feick was fatally stabbed last week.

title.children: Concerns over $12m 'white elephant' police station opposite fatal stabbing site

image.altText: A digital illustration of a large housing development in the rural area, beside a lake.

props.synopsis: The company behind a controversial planned housing development in Darwin's rural area has relaunched its bid, years after it was rejected under a different name.

title.children: Proposal for 4,000 new Darwin homes relaunched years after rejection

image.altText: A man stands with his arms crossed in front of a house next to an empty lot.

props.synopsis: The major parties have decided on a solution to Australia's housing crisis: build more homes. But some of the country's newest suburbs suggest it's not as straightforward as it seems.

title.children: 'What I feel is left out': The growing pains of Australia's newest suburbs

image.altText: A graphic shows a defence tank and aircraft over a map of Australia.

props.synopsis: Vote Compass data shows views of many Australians towards the US and China are shifting after three years of conflict, leadership changes and trade wars.

title.children: Data shows shift in views towards Australia's relationship with US and China

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with the public on a street.

props.synopsis: Both sides of politics are gearing up for a frenetic 72 hours of campaigning with Anthony Albanese planning to visit every state before election day.

title.children: Final campaign dash as Albanese sweats on Dutton suburban fightback

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Prosecutors are outlining their case against Victorian woman Erin Patterson, who stands accused of using a poisoned meal to murder three relatives. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Erin Patterson served guests deadly meals on different coloured plates to her own, jury hears

image.altText: Two men sitting on chairs in a church

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has made big promises on Russia's war in Ukraine but he's becoming an impatient broker.

title.children: After meeting with Trump, Zelenskyy once again chose his words carefully

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks while standing outside.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump acknowledges Australia's efforts to talk to him about trade and says he intends to speak to the Australian prime minister about the issue.

title.children: PM shrugs off Trump's 'throwaway comment' on Australia's efforts to call

image.altText: Jan Massey smiles, wearing a neck scarf

props.synopsis: Dozens of HESTA super fund members told ABC News they weren't aware of the planned outage, despite HESTA announcing the seven-week freeze back in February.

title.children: Super fund members caught out without access in seven-week freeze

image.altText: a composite image of two women

props.synopsis: Brooke Bellamy rejects claims by popular Australian cook Nagi Maehashi that two recipes in the cookbook Bake with Brooki are copied.

title.children: RecipeTin Eats founder accuses Brooki Bakehouse of plagiarising recipes

image.altText: A man in a suit, Xi Jinping, waves at camera.

props.synopsis: While the diplomatic tone has softened between Australia and China, the tensions between the two countries have not disappeared, and could still shape how some Australians vote on Saturday.

title.children: Dutton blames 'hate media' for his image — but in China, it's even worse

image.altText: A man with his lips pursed looking sideways

props.synopsis: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's Liberals will form government with a minority, according to Canadian public broadcaster CBC.

title.children: Mark Carney's Liberals fall short of majority in Canadian election

image.altText: A black and white image showing a comet with a long tail.

props.synopsis: Amateur astronomer Michael Mattiazzo discovered the latest comet to grace our sky. But he fears his tenth comet could be his last as a new state-of-the-art telescope is set to replace comet hunters like him.

title.children: 'It's almost cheating': How Michael hunts comets in his spare time

image.altText: A collage of black and white photos featuring pilots. an Australian kangaroo logo and soldiers holding babies.

props.synopsis: As Communist forces surrounded Saigon, these RAAF members returned to Vietnam for a final humanitarian mission.

title.children: 'Babies were just being thrown over': The final missions of the Vietnam war

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired young woman in flared jeans stands in bare feet on a house veranda.

props.synopsis: Young people in some of Australia's most expensive regional towns are disappointed with both major parties, as experts warn their policies are likely to push house prices up even further.

title.children: 'Angry' young voters in most expensive towns reject housing policies

image.altText: Andrew Lethlean addressing media with Nationals leader David Littleproud and senator Bridget McKenzie standing behind him.

props.synopsis: Nationals candidate Andrew Lethlean could face thousands of dollars in fines after selling alcohol at his Bendigo bar while its licence was suspended.

title.children: Nationals candidate Andrew Lethlean under pressure over lapsed liquor licence

image.altText: Less Kiss smiles ahead of a 2025 Super Rugby Pacific match.

props.synopsis: Les Kiss will be the next Wallabies coach, but not until next year after Joe Schmidt agreed to extend his tenure.

title.children: Kiss to succeed Schmidt as Wallabies coach in 2026

image.altText: Pedestrians shelter from rain under umbrellas in a wet city.

props.synopsis: A run of showery and stormy days is soaking Australia's east coast, while a record drought across South Australia and Victoria continues to intensify.

title.children: East coast drenching set to continue as SA, Vic struggle through big dry

image.altText: In this photo illustration a Amazon logo seen displayed on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump labels a reported plan by online retailer Amazon to display the cost of US tariffs on its products as a "hostile and political act".

title.children: Trump slams Amazon proposal to show cost of tariffs on goods

image.altText: A blue passport with the gold Australian emblem on the front. A black passport with a silver New Zealand emblem on the front.

props.synopsis: A man wanted for allegedly hacking Griffith University in 2013 left the country using a different identity and was able to re-enter Australia while a warrant for his arrest was active, court documents allege.

title.children: Accused hacker left country with passport in another name, court documents allege

image.altText: A woman with a black shirt and glasses looks at the camera in a cafe.

props.synopsis: With the world's spotlight on tiny Morwell this week, some struggling businesses are hoping a small influx of media for the mushroom trial will bring a silver lining to an event that has otherwise cast a dark cloud over the town.

title.children: Morwell residents watch on as media creates unusual sideshow outside court

image.altText: Two people, Darcy and Caitlin, sit outside a home with Caitlin holding a mug.

props.synopsis: Not a single property or room is affordable for people on Jobseeker, Youth Allowance or the Disability Support Pension in Western Australia, an Anglicare report finds.

title.children: WA rental crisis deepens amid 'catastrophic' price hikes, report finds

image.altText: Samreen takes a selfie with a scenic backdrop

props.synopsis: As debate around international student numbers intensifies, a report reveals they experience poorer mental health than their domestic counterparts.

title.children: What it’s really like to be an international student in Australia

image.altText: Portrait of black woman talking to phone virtual assistant

props.synopsis: Experts say systems relying on artificial intelligence can make your life easier. Here’s what you may want to consider if you’re a beginner.

title.children: Why you should consider using AI if you've been avoiding it

image.altText: Peter Haydon and one of his horses.

props.synopsis: Bickham Coal Company says after decades of deliberations it has "no intention" of resurrecting plans for mining on its controversial site in the NSW Upper Hunter.

title.children: 'Foal beats coal' in land use fight that divided a community

image.altText: An ambulance parked at the Alfred Hospital in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Ambulance Victoria's CEO says he's aware of two COVID-era 'honour guards' for deceased paramedics that took place at a time when Victorians were living under strict rules for gatherings.

title.children: Ambulance Victoria admits to second illegal COVID-era gathering

image.altText: Woman with short hair smiles with mouth closed

props.synopsis: The future of salmon farming in Tasmania's Macquarie Harbour remains under "active" assessment by the federal government, despite the passing of legislation designed to nullify the issue.

title.children: Despite new laws, salmon farming assessment still 'active' for Macquarie Harbour

image.altText: A view of the city with the power plant and mountains in the background

props.synopsis: Gladstone in central Queensland is a major industrial city responsible for about one third of the state's carbon emissions. As it looks to decarbonise, could the election impact the city's green hydrogen push?

title.children: Election could change the future of Australia's hydrogen capital

image.altText: A woman poses ahead of a State of Origin match

props.synopsis: Recalled New South Wales halfback Jesse Southwell has long seemed like the future of women's rugby league. Now the Blues are going all in on the returning halfback for Origin I.

title.children: NSW betting the house on Jesse Southwell in Origin I

image.altText: A mural of two sheep painted on a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The semi-rural West Australian seat of Bullwinkel, where Perth's urban fringe collides with farming, is shaping up as one of the most fiercely fought battles in the federal election.

title.children: Three-way race divides voters spread across Australia's newest electorate

props.synopsis: Two people survive a high-speed boat crash after it flips into the air and nosedives into the water at an annual race in the US.

title.children: Video shows boat flipping at 322kph while trying to break speed record
